definition: to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility

sentences.english: Having others pay your cheak is worth showing off, paying your own is worth proud of.
sentences.chinese: 男人付帳值得炫耀，但自己埋單那叫驕傲。

sentences.english: Haveing others pay your check is worth showing off, paying your own is worth proud of.
sentences.chinese: 男人付賬值得炫耀，但自己埋單那才叫驕傲。

sentences.english: Having others pay your check is worth showing off , paying your own is worth proud of.
sentences.chinese: 別人付帳值得炫耀，但自己埋單那叫驕傲。

sentences.english: Paid for by the biggest increase in debt by any peacetime government, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 用於埋單的負債增長比和平時期任何一屆政府都多。

sentences.english: He understands what guests like and what they are willing to pay for.
sentences.chinese: 他了解賓客的喜好，也明白他們願意爲什麼東西埋單。

sentences.english: We don't have to pay anything. He said he would foot the entire bill.
sentences.chinese: 我們不必付賬，他說全由他埋單。

sentences.english: When it's up to you to tip, you always leave at least 20%.
sentences.chinese: 當你埋單時，你會多給至少20%作爲小費。

sentences.english: Most men will pay for the bill when the two fell in love with each other.
sentences.chinese: 戀愛時，大多數男方會主動埋單。

sentences.english: BobbyGorilla It's ok. We can just get take-out.
sentences.chinese: 因爲美國破產了，胡過來喫飯得埋單。

sentences.english: Having others pay your check is worth showing off, paying your own is worth pround of.
sentences.chinese: 男人付賬值得炫耀，但自己埋單那叫驕傲。

sentences.english: People ultimately spend money on “all the wrong things,” the study claims.
sentences.chinese: 人們最終爲“一切錯誤的事情”埋單，報告稱。

sentences.english: Having others pay your check is worth showing off, pay your own is worth proud of.
sentences.chinese: 男人付帳值得炫耀，但自己埋單，那叫驕傲。

sentences.english: May be ancient times, and who in this moment something indispensable bill?
sentences.chinese: 可從古至今，又有誰爲這須臾不可缺少的東西埋單？

sentences.english: When the women get their bill, out come the pocket calculators.
sentences.chinese: 女人埋單時，每人掏出個計算器。

sentences.english: If the whole thing is bungled, you will be responsible.
sentences.chinese: 這件事情搞砸了，都由你自己來埋單。

sentences.english: in practice, it can come under pressure to atone for defaults.
sentences.chinese: 但在實際操作中，銀行可能會面臨爲違約埋單的壓力。

definition: to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結賬|结账
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
